meanings.definition: The quality of being morally wrong or bad.
meanings.sent1: The evilness of his actions was clear to everyone.
meanings.sent2: She could sense the evilness in his intentions.
meanings.sent3: The evilness of the situation made her laugh nervously.
meanings.sent4: The evilness of the storm seemed to engulf the entire town.
meanings.sent5: The evilness of the villain was unmatched in the story.

meanings.definition: The state or condition of being wicked or harmful.
meanings.sent1: They were afraid of the evilness that lurked in the shadows.
meanings.sent2: The evilness of the disease spread quickly through the village.
meanings.sent3: The evilness of the cat knocking over the vase was undeniable.
meanings.sent4: The evilness of the forest at night sent shivers down her spine.
meanings.sent5: The evilness of the curse haunted the old castle for centuries.
